Test Results: PassTest Instructions:
  • Navigate to reports > treasury reports > reports
  • Schedule a custom report (eg, AML Report) with date range “Custom Range”.  You should see a button to select the start date and end date. You can add in your email to receive the report in your inbox. - Pass
    • 1st Schedule Confirmation - entered All Clients, Cash Over Report. Custom Range of 10/15/2024 - 02/15/2025, Daily at 6:00pm with email
    • 2nd Schedule Confirmation- entered All Clients, Postdated Payment report, Custom Range of 8/31/2024 - 01/31/2025, Weekly Thursday at 6:00pm with email
  • Once generated, check your email for the report. The date range in the report should match the custom date range your filled in. - Pass
    • Confirmation of Cash Over Report dates displayed within range
    • Confirmation of Postdated Payments Report dates displayed within range
      • Noting I selected TXU Energy but the Report displayed Test TXU Energy
  • Go through the above flow again on the Clients page > Reports tab where you can schedule a report for a specific client. - Pass
    • Selected GNG
    • 1st Schedule Confirmation - entered Spindown Report, Custom Range of 11/01/2024 - 02/01/2025, Monthly 6th at 6:30pm with email
    • 2nd Schedule Confirmation - entered Collections Performance Report, Custom Range of 07/04/2024 - 02/07/2025, Daily at 6:30pm with email
    • Confirmation of Spindown Report dates displayed within range
    • Confirmation of Collections Performance Report dates displayed within range
      • Noting the Collections Performance Report generated on the CRM and then was emailed at 6:34pm
  • Additional checks
    • Make sure that you’re not able to save the schedule if both start date and end date are not selected - Pass
      • Confirmation “Add” is greyed out and cannot select it when start and end date are not entered
    • The “Custom Range” option is only available for “Custom Report” tab and not “Report Builder”. - Pass
      • Confirmation “Custom Range” is not available under the “Report Builder” tab
    • The option to select the start date and end date is not available for other Date Range options (eg, Today). - Pass
      • Confirmation start and end date field is not displayed on other Date Range options

Test Results: Pass
  • Goal: As a user, I can change sub-client contact information, including contact type and contact info outside of phone and email allowing for greater flexibility.
Instruction:
  • Navigate to the “Clients” page and select a client.
  • In the clients view, select the “Contact Info” tab.
    • If there are existing contacts, click on the edit button to view the Client Settings contact tab.
    • If there are no existing contacts, click “+ Add Contact” to open up the same modal.
      • Noting there were no contacts under the Miller Group at the start of testing
  • Add a new contact profile, filling in your name and contact information (phone, email, fax). Click “Save” and you should see the contact information under the “Contact Info” tab. - Pass
    • Confirmation of two sets of saved contact information
    • Noting only numbers can be entered for a Phone and Fax Contact
    • Noting any value with any length can be saved for an Email
    • Noting any value with any length can be saved for a custom Contact selecting “+ Add” as well as the contact info
  • Try out different combination when creating and editing contacts:
    • Adding/deleting contact profiles - Pass
    • Adding/deleting contact methods - Pass
    • Selecting and deselecting contact methods (A deselected contact method will not show under the “Contact Info” tab. - Pass
      • Confirmation of selection displaying correctly under Contact Info
  • Ensure the following validations:
    • Phone, Email and Fax contact methods cannot be deleted, only newly added methods can. - Pass
    • Phone, Email and Fax labels cannot be edited, only newly added methods can. Ie, “Phone” cannot be changed “(510) 123-1232” can. - Pass
      • Confirmation Phone, Email, Fax label cannot be edited and are greyed out
    • Contacts can be re-ordered using the draggable icon and reflected in the same order in the “Contact Info” tab. - Pass
      • Noting the icon is to the left of each Contact Title and will collapse into a contact box and re-arrange order as soon as you drag the contact icon up or down into the surrounding contacts
        • For example, you don’t need to drag the icon all the way up or all the way down to rearrange. You only need to drag the icon until you see the titles rearrange and then deselect/unclick the cursor
    • When any selected contact methods have missing fields, you won’t be able to click save. You should be able to if they are deselected. - Pass
      • Confirmation of required contact missing fields and cannot Save
      • Confirmation of additional contact info missing and cannot Save
      • Confirmation of deselected contacts and can Save
    • If you delete a contact without saving, that contact doesn’t get deleted. - Pass
      • Confirmed deleting a contact without saving correctly does not delete the contact info

Test Results: PassTesting Instructions - Bill Copy RequestThe purpose of this test is to ensure the expected the working functionality of Bill Copy Request.
  1. Navigate to Customers
  2. Filter “Client” by Verizon Telecom and Verizon Wireless
  3. Find a Verizon account from the results and click on “View”
    1. INT0000003
  4. In Customer’s details, under the list of accounts click on an account’s chevron icon.
  5. In the account’s detail, click on the three dots icon on the top right.
    1. In the dropdown, select “Request Bill Copy”
  6. A modal should appear:
    1. The default date will be 6 months prior - Pass
      1. Confirmation
    2. If an invalid date is inputted in “Bill Start Date”, it will prevent the user from submitting. - Pass
      1. Confirmed cannot enter months value past 12
      2. Confirmed cannot enter days value past 31
      3. Confirmed cannot enter year lower than 1000 or higher than 9999
      4. Confirmed cannot enter multiple values that don’t make sense for M, D, Y correctly
    3. The user may enter any invalid date. - Pass
      1. 01/01/1111 screenshot
      2. 09/09/9999 screenshot
    4. Click on “Submit”
  7. A toast success message should pop up - Pass
    1. Confirmation of “Bill Copy requested” notification
  8. Navigate to Additional Info for the selected account:
    1. Under Overview, there should be a new section called “Bill Copy Info” - Pass
    2. “Bill Copy Needed” should be set to Yes  - Pass
    3. “Bill Copy Start Date” should be the inputted date. - Pass
      1. Confirmation of Bill Copy Info values displayed
  9. Navigate to Account’s Activity
    1. A new entry titled “Bill Copy requested” should appear. - Pass
      1. Confirmation
        1. Noting screenshot pictures the 5 request bill copy I entered during step 6

Test Results: PassInstructions:
  1. pick any account, pull the zip code and account number.
    1. @Josh Martine Selected account 8360715709, Zip code 77449
  2. ping me the account number so I can tell you the client code
    1. 4035
  3. submit a payment for the account via payment portal using 2 payment methods. make sure the split across payment methods isn’t 50/50
    1. 1st test - Submitted payment portal payment of $96.20 between 2 ACH payment methods - $40.20 and $56.00
    2. 2nd test - Submitted payment portal payment of $74.50 between 2 ACH payment methods - $30.50 and $44.00
  4. go to the CRM, Clients > client of account you submitted a payment for > Payments > Client Code
  5. find the client code I gave to find what the expected commission rate is. note the rate
    1. note: if the client code doesn’t have a commission rate, I’m pretty sure the expected rate would be 0% (no commission).
    2. if we end up with a client code that doesn’t exist, I’ll find you an account with a valid client code
      1. Screenshot - Commission Rate = 45%
  6. submitting with split payment methods creates 1 payment per method and should line up with the amounts per payment method
    1. for example: if you submitted a $10 payment with $7 on one method, $3 on another, you should see one $7 payment and one $3 payment
      1. 2nd test - Confirmation of matching payment source, amount, and commission values
  7. find the payments in the Payment tab, scroll to the right to see the commission amount for each payment. - Pass
    1. 2nd test - Confirmation
  8. confirm the commission amounts are equal to (amount for the individual payment * (commission rate / 100))
    1. note: commission rates in the Client tab are shown as percents, ie 25 = 25%
      1. Confirmation 30.50 x (45/100) = 13.73
      2. Confirmation 44.00 x (45/100) = 19.80

Retest Results: PassTesting Instructions - Invoice Creation Separate By Agency / Client
  • This test is to ensure Verizon invoice creation works as expected when invoicing different types of payments. When selecting a mix of client and agency payments, it should create two separate invoices. The calculation method should be “gross” terms.
Testcase #1: Selecting one Client payment creates one invoice - Pass
  1. Navigate to Transaction -> Invoicing
  2. Click on “Create Invoice”
  3. Set “Client” to “Verizon Wireless”
  4. Select payments that has client transaction codes. (Appendix A)
    1. Selected PTC 3L0FMO42O8 $21.00 and 8369715268 PTC Rev -$1.33
    2. Noting 3L0FMO42O8 payment is displayed as “Payment Not in Invoice” in the ineligible items modal and is not included in the View Invoice Detail modal
    3. Did not reproduce a network error during this retest
  5. Click on “Create Invoice”
  6. In the invoice table, you should able to see an new invoice from “Verizon Wireless”
